intro: Elleanthus auriculatus, commonly known as the auriculate elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a distinctive auriculate base, giving it its common name. Elleanthus auriculatus produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months.
